guide.introduction:
Picture the scene... After many long hours spent painstakingly repairing your precious clock radio, the only step between you and completion is the final few screws. You go to scratch your face when you hear the dreaded noise of all those tiny screws hitting the floor!!! You go down to try and pick them up and they only roll further away and down into the nooks and crannies in your floor. All is lost!!!

Make this nightmare event, and many others like it a thing of the past with the Super Handy Screw Holder. This project/technique should only take you about 5 minutes if you have the proper materials, but you will probably have something suitable.

  • This Project also works for:
    • Tic Tacs.
    • Real Tacks.
    • Thumb Tacks.
    • SMD Components.
    • Fishing hooks.
    • Pretty much anything that fits in it.

lines.text: If you have an SLR camera and a lens for it, you have the optimal materials for this project (c'mon, if you have one you have the other). If you're like me, you never use the body cap or the back lens cap (I only have one lens), so lets put them to good use. If you only have one or the other, i.e. if you used your body cap for some sick nasty pinhole photography, you can use just the one, but it's cooler with both. Also, if you don't have either of those things, you can use any similarly sized/weighted dish like thing, but again, not as cool.

lines.text: I use the body cap as the actual screw holder. All you need to do it put some screws/tic tacs etc in there and screw the back lens cap onto it to create your finished container. As a closed container, you can carry around anything that fits in it. You can shake it around etc. and nothing comes out of it. Just remember to open it the right way, we are trying to avoid having screw littering the ground. I use mine to hold those screws that I remove from whatever helpless electronic product I am cracking open, but they are also good for some benchtop Tic-Tac storage.

lines.text: I know what you're thinking, "jeez that's boring, all the build up for that!!!", or if your a nicer person, "wow that's real clever, thanks, but is that all?". The answer to both those remarks is, "Well you are a maker aren't you? (come on you're on make.com) so make it better!!! You can modify your shiny new Super Handy Screw Holder to suit your every requirement.

guide.summary: Ever lost those ridiculously tiny screws you desperately need during the middle of a project only to find them a day later lodged in the bottom of your foot? If so this is just what you need to keep control of those dastardly screws.
